title: Even more data limitation on policy priorities

content.question: Which of the following statements are least supported by information on the chart?

choices.label: Most Democrats and Republicans surveyed believe that an increase in social security taxes is needed to address social security deficits.
Most Democrats and Republicans surveyed think that terrorism is a priority.
Both Democrats and Republicans surveyed believe the military is a less important priority than the economy.
A majority of respondents surveyed do not believe that reducing crime is a more important priority than reducing the budget deficit.

content.answer: Most Democrats and Republicans surveyed believe that an increase in social security taxes is needed to address social security deficits.

skill.text: Skill 3.E: Explain possible limitations of the data provided.
